td.content: s:male sheep shearer aged 26 Ys presents with 3 years history of moderate parethesia in lower limbs, severe b/l foot pain, severe frequent urination and Diabetes. he reports having no more than one drink a day he denies smoking o:Height 73 in, Weight 136 lbs, Temperature 99.1 F, Pulse 77, SystolicBP 113, DiastolicBP 74, Respiration 17, Basic Metabolic Panel BUN=30 mg/dL,creatinine=2 mg/dL, Arterial Blood Gas 6.0,HCO3=17 meq/L, rectal exam = normal, no masses found, Eyes = OD: 20/150, OU:20/100, normal pupillary reflex, DTRs: 2+ throughout, sensation = decreased pinprick sensation B/L lower extremity, appears in NAD, appropriate speech, Neuro = CN 2-12 intact, motor: 5/5 strength throughout, Extremities = B/L 2+ pitting edema throughout a:Type 1 Diabetes p:administered insulin aspart - 100 mg/mL subcutaneous daily, performed Basic Metabolic Panel, Arterial Blood Gas, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed.
